title: Medicinal plants traditionally used for management of malaria in rural communities of Uganda.
abstract: Malaria remains a major cause of morbidity and mortality especially in sub-Saharan Africa. Whereas herbal medicines have long been used for disease remedy in many African communities, there is limited evidence on the extent of use, their safety, and efficacy. This study, sought to identify herbal medicinal plants used by communities in low and high malaria transmission settings in Uganda for managing of malaria.
